content: The preliminary report from Bay Area Health Consortium highlights an unusual cluster of prion disease cases in individuals aged 48-52. Patient RG-4782, a 49-year-old tech worker residing at 2245 Marina Blvd, reported initial symptoms in March 2023. Dr. Eleanor Voss from UCSF Neurosciences ordered specialized cerebrospinal fluid testing, noting the patient's unique occupational exposure to laboratory animals. Blue Shield memo flags these cases for urgent policy review due to experimental treatment costs.
